lead_paragraph: SKODNEK--Jack. The officers, board and staff of the American Technion Society (ATS) mourn the loss of Jack Skodnek of Palm Beach, FL. He was a longtime leader of the ATS Palm Beach Chapter, and a Life Trustee of the ATS National Board of Regents. A Technion Guardian who had reached the highest level of support, Mr. Skodnek was awarded an honorary fellowship from the Technion in 2006. He and his beloved late wife Jean established the Jack and Jean Skodnek Immunobiology of Aging Research Laboratory, and the Jack and Jean Skodnek Student Eastern Village Dormitory, and generously supported numerous other Technion projects. We extend our heartfelt condolences to Mr. Skodnek's sons, Drs. Richard and Kenneth Skodnek, his sister Estelle Dermer, and the entire Skodnek family. American Society for Technion-Israel Institute of Technology; Zahava Bar-Nir, President; Scott Leemaster, Chairman of the Board; Jeffrey Richard, Executive Vice President; Melvyn H. Bloom, Executive Vice President Emeritus 1/3
